Admin Manager Job at New Age Mobile Concepts Limited




        
    

        
        New Age Mobile Concepts Limited, incorporated on August 1, 2008, is a brand for mobile phone charger. We offer not just phone chargers, but a brand that is known with innovation, consistency, panache; adopting modern and world-class technology that fits the users' fashion and convenience. For several years, we have been Nigeria’s foremost dealer in Mobile Phone Chargers. is a highly customer-centric company, obsessed with finding innovative ways to improve every customer's experience. This is built upon our easy-to-use products, skilled Customer Service Personnel and Sales Ambassadors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full time

Responsibilities
Administration & Facilities:


	Oversee office administration, asset management, and facility upkeep.
	Ensure all company premises meet safety, functionality, and compliance standards.
	Manage contracts for utilities, security, cleaning, and maintenance services.


Procurement:


	Develop and implement cost-effective procurement strategies for products, packaging, and operational supplies.
	Source, evaluate, and negotiate with suppliers to ensure quality, price competitiveness, and reliability.
	Maintain vendor records, purchase orders, and procurement documentation.


Logistics & Supply Chain:


	Oversee inbound and outbound logistics for retail, wholesale, and e-commerce distribution.
	Manage warehousing operations, stock control, and inventory accuracy.
	Coordinate with sales and product teams to ensure timely product availability.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Collaborate with finance on budgeting, cost control, and vendor payments.
	Align procurement and logistics planning with product launches and sales campaigns.
	Implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to improve efficiency.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


Salary
N500,000 - N750,000 Monthly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	We are looking for an Accountant to manage all financial transactions, from fixed payments and variable expenses to bank deposits and budgets.
	This responsibilities include auditing financial documents and procedures, reconciling bank statements and calculating tax payments and returns.

	Manage all accounting transactions
	Prepare budget forecasts

	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable
	Ensure timely bank payments

	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements
	Audit financial transactions and documents
	Comply with financial policies and regulations.

	BSc or HND in Accounting, Finance or relevant degree.

	Must be a male preferably.
	Experience with general ledger functions.
	Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills.
	Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures, including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
	Hands-on experience with accounting software like FreshBooks and QuickBooks.
	Advanced MS Excel skills.

N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

31st August, 2025.

  "description": "Deen Consult is a dynamic professional services firm specializing in Recruitment, Training, and General Business Consultation. Established with a passion for helping organizations achieve sustainable growth, we serve as a trusted partner to businesses across diverse industries. Our mission is to bridge the gap between talent, knowledge, and performance, ensuring that our clients remain competitive in today&rsquo;s fast-changing business environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description


	The Internal Auditor is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of risk management, internal controls, and governance processes within the organization.
	The role ensures compliance with company policies, statutory regulations, and industry standards while safeguarding company assets and promoting operational efficiency.


Responsibilities


	Conduct risk-based audits across alloperations, including production, inventory management, sales, marketing, procurement, and distribution.
	Review and evaluate internal controls to ensure compliance with company policies, SOPs, and regulatory requirements.
	Monitor stock control, wastage, shrinkage, and asset utilization to prevent financial and operational losses.
	Audit sales, promotions, pricing, and credit policies to ensure accuracy and prevent revenue leakages.
	Identify fraud risks, process gaps, and inefficiencies, and recommend corrective measures.
	Conduct surprise checks at plants, warehouses, depots, and retail outlets.
	Prepare clear audit reports, highlighting findings, risks, and practical recommendations for management.
	Follow up on implementation of corrective actions and provide support in process improvements.
	Liaise with external auditors, regulators, and other stakeholders when required.


Qualification andRequirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related field.
	3 &ndash; 5 years of internal audit experience, ideally within the FMCG, manufacturing, or distribution sector.
	Professional certification: ACA, ACCA, CPA, CIA, or CISA is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of auditing standards, FMCG operations, and risk management practices.
	Analytical, detail-oriented, and highly organized.
	Strong communication and report-writing skills.
	High ethical standards, independence, and ability to handle sensitive information.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;deenconsult@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Internal Auditor Job at Deen Consult




        
    

        
        Deen Consult is a dynamic professional services firm specializing in Recruitment, Training, and General Business Consultation. Established with a passion for helping organizations achieve sustainable growth, we serve as a trusted partner to businesses across diverse industries. Our mission is to bridge the gap between talent, knowledge, and performance, ensuring that our clients remain competitive in today’s fast-changing business environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor
Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Internal Auditor is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of risk management, internal controls, and governance processes within the organization.
	The role ensures compliance with company policies, statutory regulations, and industry standards while safeguarding company assets and promoting operational efficiency.


Responsibilities


	Conduct risk-based audits across alloperations, including production, inventory management, sales, marketing, procurement, and distribution.
	Review and evaluate internal controls to ensure compliance with company policies, SOPs, and regulatory requirements.
	Monitor stock control, wastage, shrinkage, and asset utilization to prevent financial and operational losses.
	Audit sales, promotions, pricing, and credit policies to ensure accuracy and prevent revenue leakages.
	Identify fraud risks, process gaps, and inefficiencies, and recommend corrective measures.
	Conduct surprise checks at plants, warehouses, depots, and retail outlets.
	Prepare clear audit reports, highlighting findings, risks, and practical recommendations for management.
	Follow up on implementation of corrective actions and provide support in process improvements.
	Liaise with external auditors, regulators, and other stakeholders when required.


Qualification andRequirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related field.
	3 – 5 years of internal audit experience, ideally within the FMCG, manufacturing, or distribution sector.
	Professional certification: ACA, ACCA, CPA, CIA, or CISA is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of auditing standards, FMCG operations, and risk management practices.
	Analytical, detail-oriented, and highly organized.
	Strong communication and report-writing skills.
	High ethical standards, independence, and ability to handle sensitive information.


Method of Application
